episodes.title: 1506: Friends
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers visits a shoe store. He helps children know that there are ups and downs in all friendships when Make-Believe friends learn that sharing can be hard. It can help to know that there are some things you don't have to share.

episodes.title: 1507: Friends
episodes.plot: Join in the fun when Mister Rogers and Mr. McFeely visit with Betty Aberlin and Mary Jo Barron who is teaching a group of children traditional games and songs. In the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, the King is planning a royal picnic

episodes.title: 1508: Friends
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers helps children learn about cooperation and deal with the difficult times of friendships in this Make-Believe story when friends and neighbors Henrietta and X hurt each others feelings. And Mister Rogers visits a restaurant.

episodes.title: 1509: Friends
episodes.plot: In the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, Daniel Tiger feels forgotten, and finds out what helps when a friend makes you sad. Mister Rogers helps children know that friendships can be repaired when friends talk about what they're feeling.

episodes.title: 1510: Friends
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers explains that friends may have hard times, but they can also build a stronger friendship each time they are together. It's raining in Make-Believe where the neighbors are finding their own ways to be peaceful together.

episodes.title: 1511: Games
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers plays peek-a boo with a towel and shows a factory where people make towels. In Make-Believe, there are plans for "Make-Believe Olympic Games." Everyone is excited except Lady Elaine who will participate only if she will win.

episodes.title: 1512: Games
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers plays a Stop-and-Go game. In Make-Believe, Lady Aberlin reassures Daniel that, in spite of what Lady Elaine Fairchilde has told him, he doesn't have to play a game her way, with her made-up rules, if he doesn't want to.

episodes.title: 1513: Games
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers has a lamp that seems to work by magic, but it's remote control. He visits a robot factory to see how people assemble big robots. In Make-Believe, there's a robot, and the neighbors learn that machines don't feel or think.

episodes.title: 1514: Games
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers plays an electronic arcade game and sees a little of how it works. In Make-Believe the neighbors are preparing for the "Make-Believe Olympic Games" and learning that it takes practice to do anything well.

episodes.title: 1515: Games
episodes.plot: Folk singer Ella Jenkins visits and plays a song on a harmonica. Mister Rogers plays a board game that features the Neighborhood of Make-Believe neighbors. In Make-Believe, it's time for the Olympic Games which begin with a grand parade.

episodes.title: 1516: Day Care and Night Care
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers visits a child care home and talks with the child care provider about what it's like there. In Make-Believe, the King and Queen are going on a trip without Prince Tuesday. He thinks that maybe they're going because he was bad.

episodes.title: 1517: Day Care and Night Care
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers shows different kinds of zippers and a factory video of how people make them. In Make-Believe, Prince Tuesday feels sad about his parents being away. It helps to talk with his "night and day caregivers" about his feelings.

episodes.title: 1518: Day Care and Night Care
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers shows a factory tour of how people make balloons. In Make-Believe, the King and Queen are away on official business and Prince Tuesday is worried that maybe his parents will not return.

episodes.title: 1519: Day Care and Night Care
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers shows his eyeglasses and talks about wearing glasses. A person who takes care of fish visits, and they talk about how even fish need care. In Make-Believe, it's nighttime and Prince Tuesday gets comforted after a scary dream.

episodes.title: 1520: Day Care and Night Care
episodes.plot: Mister Rogers visits a factory to see how people make graham crackers. In Make-Believe, the Prince is happy his parents return, but still angry that they left. He is assured there will always be people who will take good care of him.
